claim: Simulation results regarding the baseline cumulative incidence functions are presented in Figure 1.
title: Figure 1.
caption: True (grey lines) and average estimated (black dashed lines) baseline cumulative incidence functions based on 1,000 simulation replications according to cause of failure and sample size n.

claim: A schema of typical patient temporal trajectories is presented in Figure 2.
title: Figure 2.
caption: Example of four patients in a typical HIV care and treatment program.

claim: Figure 3 presents results of these quantities, based on the estimates from the optimal model, for a female patient with CD4 count at ART initiation of 120 cells/μl, by age at ART initiation.
title: Figure 3.
caption: Estimated cumulative incidence of loss to care (top left panel) and of death (top right panel) for a female patient with a CD4 count of 120 cells/μl at ART initiation, according to age at ART initiation (solid lines = 20 years; dashed lines = 30 years; dotted lines = 40 years; dashed-dotted lines = 50 years) based on the optimal model according to the grid search, with α = (2, 1.2), and estimated cumulative incidence of loss to care (bottom left panel) and of death (bottom right panel) for a male patient with a CD4 count of 120 cells/μl at ART initiation, according to age (solid lines = 20 years; dashed-dotted lines = 50 years), based on the optimal model (black lines) and the Fine-Gray – proportional odds model (gray lines) with α = (0, 1).

claim: The comparison between the predictions from the optimal model and the FGPO model are presented in the bottom row of Figure 3.
title: Figure 3.
caption: Estimated cumulative incidence of loss to care (top left panel) and of death (top right panel) for a female patient with a CD4 count of 120 cells/μl at ART initiation, according to age at ART initiation (solid lines = 20 years; dashed lines = 30 years; dotted lines = 40 years; dashed-dotted lines = 50 years) based on the optimal model according to the grid search, with α = (2, 1.2), and estimated cumulative incidence of loss to care (bottom left panel) and of death (bottom right panel) for a male patient with a CD4 count of 120 cells/μl at ART initiation, according to age (solid lines = 20 years; dashed-dotted lines = 50 years), based on the optimal model (black lines) and the Fine-Gray – proportional odds model (gray lines) with α = (0, 1).
